objective.answer: The primary objective of the paper is to explore the integration of large language models (LLMs) into the group Brainwriting ideation process, focusing on both the divergence stage of idea generation and the convergence stage of evaluation and selection of ideas.
objective.evidence: This paper explores twofold aspects of integrating LLMs into the creative process – the divergence stage of idea generation, and the convergence stage of evaluation and selection of ideas.

knowledge_gap.answer: There is limited knowledge about the merits and limitations of integrating LLMs into ideation processes, particularly in small group settings.
knowledge_gap.evidence: However, there is little knowledge about the merits and limitations of integrating LLMs into ideation processes.

answer: The paper introduces a collaborative group-AI Brainwriting ideation framework that enhances both divergent and convergent stages.
It presents an LLM idea evaluation engine that rates idea quality based on relevance, innovation, and insightfulness.
The study provides empirical insights into how novice designers engage with and perceive the process of group-AI Brainwriting.
evidence: Specific contributions include: 1) a collaborative group-AI Brainwriting ideation framework which enhances both divergent and convergent stages;
2) an LLM idea evaluation engine, which rates idea quality based on relevance, innovation, and insightfulness;
3) empirical insights into how the Brainwriting participants who are novice designers engage with and perceive the process of group-AI Brainwriting;

inspirational_papers.answer: - Paulus and Yang (2000) Their two-phase process for ideation inspired the multi-phase process in the collaborative group-AI ideation framework. (Methodological precursors)
inspirational_papers.evidence: Paulus and Yang [57] suggested a two-phase process for the ideation process, where in the second phase participants recall ideas from the first phase, thus promoting attention and cognitive stimulus.

steps.input: Participants write ideas individually on an online whiteboard.
steps.output: A set of initial ideas generated by each participant.
steps.evidence: We modified the Brainwriting process [83] so that group members sit together as a team around a shared table, but write their ideas individually, in parallel, on an online whiteboard called Conceptboard [6].

steps.output: Additional ideas generated by the LLM.
steps.evidence: In here, each group is required to use an LLM (OpenAI Playground GPT-3) to generate additional ideas.

steps.step: Selecting and developing ideas through discussion
steps.output: A narrowed list of selected ideas enhanced with LLM.
steps.evidence: Participants are instructed to select through discussion the best ideas and copy and paste them to a dedicated area on the board.

steps.input: Ideas generated during the Brainwriting process.
steps.output: Ratings for each idea based on relevance, innovation, and insightfulness.
steps.evidence: Our evaluation engine builds on the approach of Dean et al [10] for evaluating the quality of ideas and uses the dimensions of novelty (which we call innovation) and relevance to evaluate ideas.

evaluation_metrics.application: Used to evaluate the quality of ideas.

limitations.name: Limited Creativity of LLMs
limitations.description: Some students found that GPT-3 tends to be redundant and lacks creativity.
limitations.evidence: 31% of students pointed out that GPT-3 tends to be redundant and lacked creativity.

limitations.name: Challenges with Prompt Engineering
limitations.description: Students reported challenges with crafting prompts and had to employ a trial and error approach.
limitations.evidence: 25% of students reported challenges with crafting prompts and had to employ a trial and error approach to formulate prompts that produced high-quality responses from GPT-3.

future_directions.name: Enhance LLM Creativity
future_directions.description: Explore prompt engineering and custom interfaces to increase the novelty and creativity of LLM-generated ideas.
future_directions.evidence: How can we increase the novelty and creativity of the ideas contributed by an LLM to a collaborative group-AI ideation process? One possibility is through prompt engineering.

future_directions.name: Develop Training Materials for Prompt Engineering
future_directions.description: Create instructional materials for interaction designers on constructing effective prompts.
future_directions.evidence: It is thereby important to develop training materials for interaction designers in best practices of prompt engineering.
